title: Tomato plants and nematodes with 5 answer options

content.question: Which of the following is an example of a density-independent limitation on a population?

choices.label: In larger population densities of rabbits, the percentage of rabbits infected with bacteria is greater.
At greater concentrations of bacteria, nutrient supplies diminish and population growth ceases.

At higher temperatures, more tomato plants
 in a population become infested with
 nematodes than at lower temperatures.
In denser stands of oak trees, greater percentages of trees are attacked by gypsy moths than in less dense stands.

Once the population of grouse exceeds a
 certain number, the predation rate becomes
 very high.

content.answer:
At higher temperatures, more tomato plants
 in a population become infested with
 nematodes than at lower temperatures.

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
